title: All Her Fault: Sarah Snook's Terrifying Missing Child Drama Everyone Is Bingeing
shortdescription: Succession star returns in nail-biting thriller about a playdate gone horribly wrong.
author: TV Insider

content.content: The Playdate That Broke the Internet

Sarah Snook is officially back — and she’s trading Shiv Roy’s boardroom for pure maternal terror. Peacock’s All Her Fault dropped all eight episodes at midnight, and by morning it was the #1 show in 47 countries.

Based on the best-selling novel, Snook plays Marissa Irvine, a Chicago mom whose 4-year-old son vanishes after a seemingly innocent playdate with a woman she’s never met. What follows is a slow-burn descent into paranoia, buried secrets, and suburban warfare.

The Hollywood Reporter called it “the most anxiety-inducing thriller since Gone Girl,” while The Guardian hailed Snook’s performance as “a masterclass in barely contained panic.” Viewers report finishing the entire season in one sleepless night.
